74  class TtlInterfaceCore : public common::util::IDriverCore, public common::util::IInterfaceCore
75  {
76  public:
77  TtlInterfaceCore(ros::NodeHandle &nh);
78  ~TtlInterfaceCore() override;
79  // non copyable class
80  TtlInterfaceCore(const TtlInterfaceCore &) = delete;
81  TtlInterfaceCore(TtlInterfaceCore &&) = delete;
82

95 
96  // we have to use ISingleMotorCmd instead of AbstractTtlMotorCmd because this is pure virtual method in IDriverCore
97  // IDriverCore used by Can and Ttl so AbstractTtlMotorCmd or AbstractCanMotorCmd can't be used in this case
98  void addSingleCommandToQueue(std::unique_ptr<common::model::ISingleMotorCmd> &&cmd) override;
99  void addSingleCommandToQueue(std::vector<std::unique_ptr<common::model::ISingleMotorCmd>> cmd) override;

103  int initMotor(const std::shared_ptr<common::model::AbstractMotorState> &motor_state);
104

227  // ttl cmds
228  // TODO(CC) it seems like having two queues can lead to pbs if a sync is launched before the sincle queue is finished
229  // and vice versa. So having a unique queue would be preferable (see calibration)
230  std::queue<std::unique_ptr<common::model::AbstractTtlSynchronizeMotorCmd>> _sync_cmds_queue;
231  std::queue<std::unique_ptr<common::model::AbstractTtlSingleMotorCmd>> _single_cmds_queue;
232  std::queue<std::unique_ptr<common::model::AbstractTtlSingleMotorCmd>> _conveyor_cmds_queue;
233 
234  ros::ServiceServer _activate_leds_server;

244 
245  ros::ServiceServer _frequencies_setter;
246  ros::ServiceServer _frequencies_getter;
247 
248  static constexpr int QUEUE_OVERFLOW = 20;
249  };
250 
251  inline void TtlInterfaceCore::setEstopFlag(bool value)
252  {
253  _estop_flag = value;
254  }
255 
260  inline bool TtlInterfaceCore::isConnectionOk() const
261  {
262  return _ttl_manager->isConnectionOk();
263  }
264 
269  inline common::model::EBusProtocol
270  TtlInterfaceCore::getBusProtocol() const
271  {
272  return common::model::EBusProtocol::TTL;
273  }
274 
279  inline std::vector<uint8_t> TtlInterfaceCore::getRemovedMotorList() const
280  {
281  return _ttl_manager->getRemovedMotorList();
282  }
283 
289  inline bool TtlInterfaceCore::getCollisionStatus() const
290  {
291  return _ttl_manager->getCollisionStatus();
292  }
293 
297  inline void TtlInterfaceCore::setCalibrationStatus(const common::model::EStepperCalibrationStatus status)
298  {
299  ROS_INFO("Set calibration status is not availble for TTL");
300  }
